definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) Something that a person likes (prefers).
definitions.example: Tell me your likes and dislikes.

definitions.definition: An individual vote showing support for, or approval of, something posted on the Internet.
To enjoy, be pleased by; favor; be in favor of.
To please.
To derive pleasure of, by or with someone or something.
To prefer and maintain (an action) as a regular habit or activity.
definitions.example: I like to go to the dentist every six months.

definitions.definition: To have an appearance or expression; to look; to seem to be (in a specified condition).
To come near; to avoid with difficulty; to escape narrowly.
definitions.example: He liked to have been too late.

definitions.definition: To find attractive; to prefer the company of; to have mild romantic feelings for.
definitions.example: I really like Sandra but don't know how to tell her.

definitions.definition: To liken; to compare.
To show support for, or approval of, something posted on the Internet by marking it with a vote.
definitions.example: I can't stand Bloggs' tomato ketchup, but I liked it on Facebook so I could enter a competition.

definitions.definition: (with 'would' and in certain other phrases) To want, desire. See also would like.
definitions.example: We could go to the museum if you like.

definitions.definition: (sometimes as the likes of') Someone similar to a given person, or something similar to a given object; a comparative; a type; a sort.
definitions.example: It was something the likes of which I had never seen before.

definitions.definition: The stroke that equalizes the number of strokes played by the opposing player or side.
Similar.
definitions.example: My partner and I have like minds.

definitions.definition: Likely; probable.
Likely.
In a like or similar manner.
Similar to, reminiscent of.
Typical of
definitions.example: It would be just like Achilles to be sulking in his tent.

definitions.definition: Approximating
definitions.example: Popcorn costs something like $10 dollars at the movies.

definitions.definition: In the manner of, similarly to.
definitions.example: He doesn't act like a president.

definitions.definition: Such as
As if there would be.
definitions.example: It looks like a hot summer in Europe.

definitions.definition: As, the way.
As if; as though.
definitions.example: It looks like you've finished the project.

definitions.definition: Used to place emphasis upon a statement.
To be likely.
